calculator module

final class calculator.AddOperation

Klasy bazowe: Operation

Adds two numbers.

execute(a: int | float, b: int | float) → int | float

Execute the arithmetic operation.

Parametry:

  • a (Numeric) – The first operand.

  • b (Numeric) – The second operand.

Zwraca:

The result of the operation.

Typ zwracany:

Numeric

final class calculator.Calculator(factory: OperationFactory)

Klasy bazowe: object

A calculator that uses specific operation strategies to perform calculations. Follows SRP: its responsibility is to orchestrate the calculation, delegating the actual computation to strategy objects.

calculate(a: int | float, b: int | float, operator: Literal['+', '-', '*', '/']) → int | float

Perform a calculation using the specified operation.

Parametry:

  • a (Numeric) – The first operand.

  • b (Numeric) – The second operand.

  • operator (OperationSymbol) – The symbol for the operation to perform.

Zwraca:

The result of the calculation.

Typ zwracany:

Numeric

Wyrzuca:

ValueError – If the operator is unsupported or if division by zero is attempted.

final class calculator.DivideOperation

Klasy bazowe: Operation

Divides the first number by the second. Returns a float.

execute(a: int | float, b: int | float) → float

Execute the arithmetic operation.

Parametry:

  • a (Numeric) – The first operand.

  • b (Numeric) – The second operand.

Zwraca:

The result of the operation.

Typ zwracany:

Numeric

  • b (Numeric) – The second operand.

class calculator.Operation

Klasy bazowe: ABC

Abstract base class for an arithmetic operation. (Strategy Interface)

abstractmethod execute(a: int | float, b: int | float) → int | float

Execute the arithmetic operation.

Parametry:

  • a (Numeric) – The first operand.

  • b (Numeric) – The second operand.

Zwraca:

The result of the operation.

Typ zwracany:

Numeric

final class calculator.OperationFactory

Klasy bazowe: object

Factory class to get an operation strategy. Follows SRP: its only responsibility is to create/provide operation objects.

get_operation(operator: Literal['+', '-', '*', '/']) → Operation

Get the operation object for the given operator symbol.

Parametry:

operator (OperationSymbol) – The symbol representing the desired operation («+», «-», «*», «/»).

Zwraca:

The concrete operation strategy.

Typ zwracany:

Operation

Wyrzuca:

ValueError – If the operator is not supported.

final class calculator.SubtractOperation

Klasy bazowe: Operation

Subtracts the second number from the first.

execute(a: int | float, b: int | float) → int | float

Execute the arithmetic operation.

Parametry:

  • a (Numeric) – The first operand.

  • b (Numeric) – The second operand.

Zwraca:

The result of the operation.

Typ zwracany:

Numeric

calculator.main() → None

Example usage of the refactored calculator.
